intro: Ruellia metallica, commonly known as the silverleaf ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it its common name. Its flowers are tubular and come in shades of blue or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Ruellia metallica is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms.
